answer: The heating of X-Ray hot gas in galaxy groups can be informed by the evolution of blast waves in these groups, which can heat the gas internally or externally, depending on the redshift and the type of blast wave driver (astro-ph/0102221).
explanation: This paper investigates the evolution of blast waves in galaxy groups and their role in heating the X-Ray hot gas, providing insights into the conditions that determine whether the gas is heated externally or internally.
evidence_quote: Heating of X-Ray Hot Gas in Groups by Blast Waves
